content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The tables below show data for Greenville and Joescape, which are two small, fictitious countries.

Greenville

Joescape

Year

 <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$600" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

 <math alttext="$300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="140" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$560" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>560</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="125" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$400" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate each of the following for Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita for Greenville(ii) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita for Joescape

(b) If Greenville and Joescape have the same velocity of money in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which country must have the higher money supply in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(c) Calculate each of the following in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) The inflation rate in Greenville(ii) The inflation rate in Joescape

(d) Based on your answer to part (c), if the nominal interest rate is the same for both countries in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which country experiences the higher real interest rate in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(e) Assume loans in Greenville were made taking into account an expected inflation rate of <math alttext="20%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Will borrowers in Greenville be better off, worse off, or not affected after they realize the actual inflation rate calculated in part (c)(i) ? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
